content: crocheted double thick coaster pictures format and text by katy philby this pattern was originally published on 3/31/2012 on my blog this is an updated version that is a free download on ravelry com this is a pattern many people have used for coasters hotpads and potholders i learned it as a summer volunteer working at living history farms crochet was a very appropriate pastime for victorian ladies ** crochet difficulty ​ skills needed crochet chain single_crochet slip_stitch ​ notions yarn needle scissors ​ hook us h-8 5 0mm ​ abbreviations us terms chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch sts = stitches yarn 1 skein worsted weight cotton ​ suggested lily sugar n cream cotton ​ i can make two coasters from one skein sizes small medium medium size is nice for larger coffee mugs double thick coaster ©2020 katy philby llama love page 1 of 2 the pattern chain 25 28 round 1 in the second chain from the hook single_crochet 1 ​ continue to single_crochet 1 in each chain across single_crochet 2 in the last chain to make the corner and continue along the back side of the chain with 1 single_crochet in each chain round 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around ​ continue repeating round 2 your coaster will start to curl up into a canoe shape or a pouch shape as you add row check to see how close you are to having a square by pushing in the top corners of your pouch so they meet in the middle when they meet without a gap your coaster is square finish off leaving a long tail for sewing up using a yarn needle thread it with the long yarn tail whipstitch the two sides together to create a square weave in tail ends optional make a larger one to use as a potholder by ​ making a longer starting chain you can even chain a little hanging loop before you finish it off at the end double thick coaster ©2020 katy philby llama love page 2 of 2
